clinical_study.brief_title: Developing a Lifestyle Intervention for South Asians
clinical_study.official_title: Better Together: Leveraging Primary Care and Social Network Resources to Create a Patient-centered Approach to Improve Diabetes Among South Asians

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to test the hypothesis that a culturally tailored lifestyle intervention can improve health behaviors among South Asians with prediabetes and diabetes

detailed_description.textblock: This pre-post pilot study is a 16 week lifestyle program for South Asians with prediabetes or diabetes in Atlanta. Patients will participate in physician-led group visits every other week focused on improving dietary and exercise practices to reduce weight.

primary_outcome.description: Physician-participants interviews will be digitally audio-recorded and transcribed verbatim, with de-identified transcripts analyzed.
Number of participants retained will be recorded and SMA retention rate will be calculated

secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) is a number representing person's weight in kilograms divided by the square of height in meters. A high BMI can be an indicator of high body fatness.
Blood pressure will be measured pre- and post- intervention
Cholesterol level will be measured by blood test pre- and post- intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity daily minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Daily minutes of moderate intensity exercise will be self reported by participants
Daily step counts (using wearable perdometer) will be recorded.
Pre-post assessment of change in consumption will be done using food frequency questionnaire. It has 16 questions that assess dietary habits over the past week.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Healthy lifestyle Shared Medical Appointment (SMA) program
arm_group.description: South Asian (SA) adults with prediabetes and Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) that are 'information rich' and have variation in background characteristics will be identified. Dyads (spouses, parent/adolescent or young adult child, peers) will participate in a 16-week culturally-tailored, community-informed pre-post SMA intervention to improve health behaviors.

intervention.intervention_name: Healthy lifestyle Shared Medical Appointment (SMA) program
intervention.description: Social network-based, culturally-tailored healthy lifestyle SMA program for high risk SAs will be piloted to collect pre-post data on diet and exercise habits, and to determine feasibility and acceptability. Patients will participate in physician-led group visits every other week focused on improving dietary and exercise practices to reduce weight. Biometric measurements (weight, height, blood pressure) will be collected, point of care glucose and lipid testing will be done.
